description.what: Large hall reverb with extended decay (4+ seconds) and bright, spacious character designed for dramatic impact
when: lead vocals in arena rock or stadium anthems
electric guitar solos requiring epic space
synth leads in EDM builds and drops
description.why: Long decay time (4.0-4.5s) creates the perception of a massive enclosed space like an arena or concert hall. Bright high-frequency shelf (+2dB @ 7kHz) adds air and excitement, mimicking the reflective surfaces of large venues. Wide stereo image (110-120°) maximizes spaciousness and envelopment. Moderate predelay (20-25ms) maintains source clarity while establishing natural distance cues consistent with large room acoustics.

use_cases.context: arena rock, stadium anthems, dramatic ballads
use_cases.send_level_rationale: Moderate amount allows space to breathe around vocal without drowning intelligibility
use_cases.eq_rationale: Removes low-end rumble that would build up excessively in long tail
use_cases.notes: Predelay 20-25ms keeps consonants clear. Consider sidechain ducking reverb send during verses, open up in choruses. Bright character can emphasize sibilance—use de-esser before send if needed.

use_cases.send_level_rationale: Higher amount creates sustain and width without muddying rhythm section
use_cases.eq_rationale: Tightens low-mids while preserving guitar body
use_cases.notes: Bright tail emphasizes pick attack and harmonics. Long decay fills gaps between notes, creating sustain similar to natural room acoustics.

use_cases.context: EDM builds, cinematic production, ambient passages
use_cases.send_level_rationale: Synthetic sources can handle more wetness; creates evolving texture
use_cases.eq_rationale: HPF prevents sub buildup; LPF can tame excessive brightness on already-bright synths
use_cases.notes: Automate send level during builds (low to high). Consider freezing tail during breakdowns for textural pads.

use_cases.send_level_rationale: Use as special effect, not primary snare verb
use_cases.eq_rationale: Keeps focus on snare body and crack, removes sub rumble
use_cases.notes: Typically automated—open send on final hit of fill. Not for every snare hit. Consider gating the return.

predelay.rationale: Natural predelay for large spaces. Path length difference ≈ 6.9m (20ms × 0.343 m/ms), consistent with arena-sized room. Maintains vocal/source clarity by separating direct sound from reverb onset (Haas/precedence effect).

size.rationale: Large virtual room volume simulates arena/concert hall scale. Increases early reflection spacing and tail density growth rate.

decay.rationale: RT60-style decay time. 4.0s creates emotional impact and drama. Typical for reverberant concert halls (3-4s) and arenas (3-5s depending on treatment).

high_shelf_gain.rationale: Bright character (+2dB @ 7kHz). Mimics reflective surfaces in large venues (glass, metal, hard walls). Adds air and excitement. Can emphasize sibilance—monitor and adjust.

high_shelf_freq.rationale: Shelf frequency at 7kHz boosts presence and air without excessive harshness. Above fundamental vocal/guitar range, affects harmonics and sparkle.

low_shelf_gain.rationale: Cuts low frequencies to prevent muddy buildup in long tail. Simulates natural HF/LF decay differential (soft surfaces absorb lows faster).

low_shelf_freq.rationale: Shelf at 160Hz tightens low-mids without thinning the reverb excessively. Keeps tail clean while preserving body.

stereo_image.rationale: Very wide stereo image (115°) creates spaciousness and envelopment. Near-maximum width for dramatic stereo field. Check mono compatibility.

diffuse_level.rationale: Emphasizes tail over early reflections (+2dB). Creates distant, ambient character rather than proximity. Pushes source 'back' in mix depth.

reflect_level.rationale: Neutral early reflection level. Tail-dominant preset—early reflections present but not emphasized.

diffusion.rationale: High diffusion creates smooth, dense tail without metallic flutter. Avoids grainy artifacts common in lower diffusion settings.

tighter.explanation: Shortens decay to 3.0s and reduces room size to 60 for more controlled, less overwhelming space. Retains character while fitting denser mixes.

looser.explanation: Extends decay to 4.5s and increases size to 85 for maximum drama and spaciousness. Use sparingly—can wash out mix.

warmer.explanation: Reduces high shelf to 0dB (flat) for warmer, less bright tail. Reduces sibilance emphasis, creates vintage/darker character.

brighter.explanation: Increases high shelf to +3dB for extra air and sparkle. Use carefully—can over-emphasize sibilance and cymbals.

closer.explanation: Reduces predelay to 10ms, boosts early reflections +2dB, cuts tail -1dB. Brings source forward in mix depth while retaining tail character.

further.explanation: Increases predelay to 25ms, reduces early reflections, emphasizes tail. Pushes source deeper into mix space.

wider.explanation: Increases stereo width to 120° (maximum) and adds subtle chorus modulation for enhanced spaciousness. Check mono compatibility.

narrower.explanation: Reduces stereo to 90° and removes chorus for more focused, mono-compatible image. Retains space without extreme width.

cleaner.explanation: Further cuts low shelf to -4dB and raises input HPF to clean up low-end buildup. Tightens tail for clarity in dense mixes.

fuller.explanation: Reduces low shelf cut to -0.5dB and increases diffusion to 85 for richer, denser tail. Adds body and smoothness.

more_dramatic.explanation: Extends decay to 4.5s, boosts tail +3dB, increases brightness +3dB for maximum impact. Use for climactic moments.

subtle.explanation: Shortens decay to 2.5s, reduces tail level +0.5dB, warms to +1dB for understated ambience. Background glue vs featured effect.

warnings.mono_compatibility: Stereo width of 115° is very wide. In mono playback, phase cancellation may reduce reverb presence. Test mono fold-down for broadcast/streaming compatibility.
warnings.cpu_usage: Long decay (4.0s) + large size (75) + high diffusion (80) = moderate-to-high CPU usage. Reduce Density parameter if experiencing performance issues.
warnings.mix_context: Overwhelming in dense mixes with multiple reverb sends. Use sparingly—typically 1-2 featured elements (lead vocal, solo). Consider automating send levels (low in verses, high in choruses).
warnings.frequency_buildup: Bright high shelf (+2dB @ 7kHz) can emphasize vocal sibilance (5-8kHz) and cymbal wash. Use de-esser before send or reduce high shelf if tail becomes harsh.
warnings.low_end_accumulation: 4.0s decay allows low frequencies to build up even with -2dB low shelf. Add HPF @ 180-220Hz before send on all sources except kick/bass.
